sentence.Network_en: They had blocked off the fireplaces to stop draughts.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们已经封住了壁炉，以阻挡通风。

sentence.Network_cn: 他正和艾伯特在书房的炉火旁下国际跳棋。

sentence.Network_en: Block draughts around doors and windows.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from draught; related to obsolete draught in the sense 'move' (in chess or any similar game); compare with French trait, from Latin tractus 'a dragging'

entry.def: A draught is a current of air that comes into a place in an undesirable way.

example.ex: Block draughts around doors and windows...
On a cold day there can be quite a draught from the letterbox.
example.tran: 天冷的时候能明显感觉到从信箱那边吹来的过堂风。

entry.def: Draught beer is beer which is kept in barrels rather than bottles.
A draught of liquid is a large amount that you swallow.

example.ex: He took a draught of beer...
Having added more fruit juice on top, drink it down in one draught.
example.tran: 在上面再加些果汁后，把它一口喝掉。

entry.def: Draughts is a game for two people, played with 24 round pieces on a board.

example.ex: He was in the study playing draughts by the fire with Albert.
example.tran: 他正和艾伯特在书房的炉火旁下国际跳棋。

entry.def: A draught is one of the round pieces which are used in the game of draughts.
A draught animal is one which pulls heavy loads, for example on a farm.
A draught is a medicine in the form of a liquid which you drink.

example.ex: One of the night-duty nuns gave her a sleeping draught.
example.tran: 一个值夜班的修女给了她一剂安眠药水。

means.word_mean: 1. a checkerboard game for two players who each have 12 pieces; the object is to jump over and so capture the opponent's pieces

auth_sentence.content: A room so lofty and so full of draughts as to put the damper on any occasion.
